words.definition: When something is arduous, it demands great effort or labor.
words.example: The explorers began their arduous hike up the steep mountain.

words.definition: To attain something means to gain or achieve it, often after a lot of effort.
words.example: In two more years, I will attain my high school diploma.

words.definition: To coexist with something means to exist with it in the same time and place.
words.example: Our pets coexist at our home with little or no problems.

words.definition: To conceive something means to be able to imagine or create it.
words.example: The scientist conceived a new theory about the universe.

words.definition: When something is dubious, it is not considered honest or safe.
words.example: I was dubious about the business proposal.

words.definition: An ego is a person's sense of their own worth.
words.example: His large ego made it difficult for him to accept criticism.

words.definition: If something is elastic, it can stretch and then return to its original shape.
words.example: The rubber band was very elastic.

words.definition: To endeavor means to try hard to do something.
words.example: We should endeavor to help those in need.

words.definition: To engrave means to cut designs or words into a surface.
words.example: The jeweler engraved their names inside the rings.

words.definition: To excavate means to dig on land to find things from the past.
words.example: Archeologists excavated the ancient city.

words.definition: When something is jagged, it has a tough, uneven surface or edge.
words.example: The jagged rocks made it hard to walk on the beach.

words.definition: A locale is a small area where something happens or is set.
words.example: The locale of the movie was a small village in France.

words.definition: A mold is a hollow container used to shape something.
words.example: She poured the melted chocolate into a heart-shaped mold.

words.definition: When something is outright, it is open and direct.
words.example: The winner of the race was outright and clear.

words.definition: The periphery of something is its edge or boundary.
words.example: The trees were planted along the periphery of the park.

words.definition: Plaster is a smooth paste that gets hard when it dries.
words.example: He used plaster to fix the hole in the wall.

words.definition: A shovel is a tool with a long handle and a flat blade for digging.
words.example: He used a shovel to clear the snow from the driveway.

words.definition: When something is skeletal, it relates to bones.
words.example: The skeletal remains were found in the cave.

words.definition: If something is terrestrial, it relates to Earth.
words.example: There are many terrestrial animals in the forest.

words.definition: When something or someone is vicious, they are violent and cruel.
words.example: The vicious dog barked at the stranger.
